name: Guarantor
description: The GT1 segment contains information about the party responsible for paying all or part of the patient's account. This may be the patient, spouse, parent, guarantor, or another party. The GT1 segment is used in conjunction with insurance information to establish financial responsibility and billing arrangements.

cardinality.note: Multiple GT1 segments can appear for multiple guarantors with different financial responsibilities

GT1.1.name: Set ID - GT1
GT1.1.description: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one; for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two; etc.
GT1.1.generationHint: Sequential number starting from 1 for each GT1 in a message

GT1.2.name: Guarantor Number
GT1.2.description: This field contains the guarantor's unique identifier within the healthcare organization. This may be the same as the patient ID if the patient is the guarantor.

GT1.3.name: Guarantor Name
GT1.3.description: This field contains the guarantor's name. Multiple names may be sent in the repeating field.

GT1.4.name: Guarantor Spouse Name
GT1.4.description: This field contains the name of the guarantor's spouse, when applicable for billing or contact purposes.
GT1.4.generationHint: Same format as GT1.3, used when spouse information is relevant

GT1.5.name: Guarantor Address
GT1.5.description: This field contains the guarantor's mailing address. Multiple addresses may be specified.

GT1.6.name: Guarantor Ph Num - Home
GT1.6.description: This field contains the guarantor's home telephone number. Multiple home phone numbers may be specified.

GT1.7.name: Guarantor Ph Num - Business
GT1.7.description: This field contains the guarantor's business telephone number. Multiple business phone numbers may be specified.
GT1.7.generationHint: Format similar to GT1.6 but for business/work phone numbers

GT1.8.name: Guarantor Date/Time of Birth
GT1.8.description: This field contains the guarantor's date and time of birth. Used for identification and verification purposes.
GT1.8.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, often just date portion used: YYYYMMDD

GT1.9.name: Guarantor Administrative Sex
GT1.9.description: This field contains the guarantor's administrative sex. Values from HL7 Table 0001.

GT1.10.name: Guarantor Type
GT1.10.description: This field identifies the guarantor type or the guarantor's relationship to the patient. Values from user-defined table 0063.
GT1.10.generationHint: Most common: SEL (self), SPO (spouse), PAR (parent), GRD (guardian)

GT1.11.name: Guarantor Relationship
GT1.11.description: This field describes the relationship of the guarantor to the patient. Values from user-defined table 0063.

validValues.description: Minor dependent of a minor dependent

GT1.12.name: Guarantor SSN
GT1.12.description: This field contains the guarantor's social security number. Used for identification and billing purposes.
GT1.12.generationHint: Format: XXX-XX-XXXX, use 9XX format to avoid real SSN numbers

GT1.13.name: Guarantor Date - Begin
GT1.13.description: This field contains the date from which the guarantor becomes financially responsible for the patient's account.
GT1.13.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDD, typically admission date or earlier

GT1.14.name: Guarantor Date - End
GT1.14.description: This field contains the date until which the guarantor is financially responsible for the patient's account.
GT1.14.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDD, should be after GT1.13 begin date

GT1.15.name: Guarantor Priority
GT1.15.description: This field identifies the priority sequence of this guarantor relative to other guarantors for the same patient. 1 indicates the primary guarantor.
GT1.15.generationHint: Numeric priority: 1 = primary, 2 = secondary, 3 = tertiary, etc.

GT1.16.name: Guarantor Employer Name
GT1.16.description: This field contains the name of the guarantor's employer. Used for billing and contact information.

GT1.17.name: Guarantor Employer Address
GT1.17.description: This field contains the address of the guarantor's employer. Used for billing and verification purposes.
GT1.17.generationHint: Business address format same as GT1.5

GT1.18.name: Guarantor Employ Phone Number
GT1.18.description: This field contains the telephone number of the guarantor's employer. Multiple employer phone numbers may be specified.
GT1.18.generationHint: Business phone format same as GT1.6

GT1.19.name: Guarantor Employee ID Number
GT1.19.description: This field contains the guarantor's employee identification number as assigned by their employer.

GT1.20.name: Guarantor Employment Status
GT1.20.description: This field describes the guarantor's employment status. Values from user-defined table 0066.

GT1.21.name: Guarantor Organization Name
GT1.21.description: This field contains the name of the organization with which the guarantor is associated, when different from employer.

GT1.22.name: Guarantor Billing Hold Flag
GT1.22.description: This field indicates whether billing for this guarantor should be held or suspended. Values: Y (hold billing), N (do not hold billing).
GT1.22.generationHint: Usually N (do not hold), Y only for special circumstances

GT1.23.name: Guarantor Credit Rating Code
GT1.23.description: This field contains the guarantor's credit rating code. Values from user-defined table 0341.
GT1.23.generationHint: Credit ratings: EXC, GOOD, FAIR, POOR based on financial assessment

GT1.24.name: Guarantor Death Date and Time
GT1.24.description: This field contains the date and time of the guarantor's death, if applicable.
GT1.24.generationHint: Format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, usually empty unless guarantor is deceased

GT1.25.name: Guarantor Death Flag
GT1.25.description: This field indicates whether the guarantor is deceased. Values: Y (deceased), N (not deceased).
GT1.25.generationHint: Usually N (not deceased), Y only if GT1.24 death date is present

examples: GT1|2|GT789012^^^MR|SMITH^JANE^MARIE||456 ELM AVE^^COLUMBUS^OH^43215^USA|(614) 555-1234|(614) 555-5678|19750322|F|SPO|02^Spouse^HL70063|987-65-4321|20220815||2|DEF INDUSTRIES|789 CORPORATE BLVD^^COLUMBUS^OH^43216^USA|(614) 555-8888|EMP789012^^^EI|1||N|EXC||N
notes: GT1 segment can appear multiple times for multiple guarantors
GT1.1 (Set ID) is required and should be sequential within a message
GT1.3 (Guarantor Name) is required for identification purposes
GT1.15 (Priority) determines billing order when multiple guarantors exist
Guarantor may be the patient (self-pay) or a different person/organization
Employment information (GT1.16-GT1.21) is important for billing and verification

conditional.GT1.2: Should be provided for guarantor identification
conditional.GT1.24: Should only be present if GT1.25 = Y
conditional.GT1.25: Should be Y if GT1.24 is present

relationships.GT1.13_GT1.14: End date must be after begin date if both present
relationships.GT1.24_GT1.25: Death date and flag should be consistent
relationships.GT1.10_GT1.11: Guarantor type and relationship should align

validation.GT1.9: Must be valid HL7 Table 0001 administrative sex code
validation.GT1.10: Must be valid user-defined table 0063 relationship code
validation.GT1.20: Must be valid user-defined table 0066 employment status code
validation.GT1.22: Must be Y or N if present
validation.GT1.25: Must be Y or N if present
